Report p. 1

Accounting & Reporting Issues Findings
Accounting & Reporting Issues
Findings

◼ On a statewide basis, there is no systematic method to account separately for to/from transportation, and the tools that do exist are incomplete and not audited.
◼ On a statewide basis, there is no systematic ◼ O n
a
s t a t e w i d e
b a s i s ,
t h e r e
i s
n o
s y s t e m a t i c
method to account separately for to/from
transportation, and the tools that do exist are
incomplete and not audited.

◼ Accounting and reporting of certain
◼ Accounting and reporting of certain ◼ A c c o u n t i n g
a n d
r e p o r t i n g
o f
c e r t a i n

transportation costs are not consistent across districts.
transportation costs are not consistent across
districts.

E.g., Bus aides, utilities, insurance
E.g., Bus aides, utilities, insurance

Report pp 16-19
Report pp 16-19

JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study
JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study

Accounting & Reporting Issues Recommendation 1
Accounting & Reporting Issues
Recommendation 1

The Legislature should require districts to separate to/from transportation costs from other transportation costs when reporting expenditures, so that the State can determine the extent to which funding reflects eligible transportation costs.
The Legislature should require districts to
separate to/from transportation costs from
other transportation costs when reporting
expenditures, so that the State can determine
the extent to which funding reflects eligible
transportation costs.

OSPI and OFM concur
OSPI and OFM concur

Report p. 19
Report p. 19

JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study
JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study

Accounting & Reporting Issues Recommendation 2
Accounting & Reporting Issues
Recommendation 2

The Superintendent of Public Instruction, in consultation with the State Auditor, should adopt rules and clarify instructions for tracking and reporting transportation costs.
The Superintendent of Public Instruction, in
consultation with the State Auditor, should adopt
rules and clarify instructions for tracking and
reporting transportation costs.

OSPI and OFM concur
OSPI and OFM concur

Report pp. 19-20
Report pp. 19-20

JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study
JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study

Current Funding Method Finding
Current Funding Method
Finding

On a statewide basis, JLARC estimates that there is a 95% probability that to/from pupil transportation expenditures exceeded state funding by $93 ⎯ $114 million in the 2004-05 school year.
On a statewide basis, JLARC estimates that
there is a 95% probability that to/from pupil
transportation expenditures exceeded state
funding by $93 ⎯ $114 million in the f u n d i n g

⎯ $ 1 1 4
m i l l i o n
i n
t h e
2004-05 school year.

Statutory & WAC Issues Finding
Statutory & WAC Issues
Finding

Definitional issues in statute and WAC currently prevent the funding method from reflecting actual costs.
Definitional issues in statute and WAC currently
prevent the funding method from reflecting
actual costs.

➢ WAC definitions around eligible shuttles are ➢ W A C

Statutory & WAC Issues Recommendation 3
Statutory & WAC Issues
Recommendation 3

The Legislature should review statutory language to ensure that there is clarity around what transportation costs the State intends to fund.
The Legislature should review statutory
language to ensure that there is clarity around
what transportation costs the State intends to
fund.

OSPI and OFM concur
OSPI and OFM concur

Report p. 42
Report p. 42

JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study
JLARC K-12 Pupil Transportation Funding Study

Statutory & WAC Issues Recommendation 4
Statutory & WAC Issues
Recommendation 4

OSPI should change its WACs to conform to statute to ensure that all qualifying trips can generate funding by the State.
OSPI should change its WACs to conform to
statute to ensure that all qualifying trips can
generate funding by the State.

OSPI and OFM concur
OSPI and OFM concur

OSPI adopted emergency WACs related to this recommendation in August 2006
OSPI adopted emergency WACs related to this
recommendation in August 2006

Current Funding Method Recommendation 5
Current Funding Method
Recommendation 5

The Legislature should establish a method for providing funds to operate to/from pupil transportation programs that reflects costs and the State’s priorities in funding.
The Legislature should establish a method for
providing funds to operate to/from pupil
transportation programs that reflects costs and
the State’s priorities in funding.
